pros: Engaging and stimulating work environment
cons: Workload balance can be hard to achieve

pros: - interdisciplinary team - flexible hours - fun team
cons: No cons, it was a very fun temporary position

pros: Supportive people - plus fairly flexible
cons: Not so great hours - many late hour shifts

pros: Easy to talk to supervisors University is a fun place to work
cons: Pay is a bit low, but it is clear what your pay is. Great experience for students!

pros: Work life balance, low pressure, lots of leave time.
cons: The pay can be improved

review_title: Ypur experience can drastically vary from fine to nightmare.
pros: The work life balance can be great, and the compensation is decent enough.
cons: There is a major swing in the quality of management, from fine and friendly to aggressive and vindictive. Some departments can not retain staff and will overwork others to compensate.

pros: Excellent benefits and the campus is beautiful
cons: Salaries are frozen and there very few opportunities to advance.

job_title: Community Peace Officer in Edmonton, AB
pros:
Close to home.
Benefits were good.
cons:
Absolutely toxic workplace.
Toxic staff, toxic management. Prioritize image over safety. 
Most of the staff within security services are dishonest would intentionally try and get coworkers in trouble by making up stories.
When caught, they are also dishonest.
The peace officer program is a waste of time at this institution.

pros: Steady paycheck, decent benefits, a few amazing colleagues.
cons: On a real downward trajectory over the past few years. Layoffs are bad enough, but management and upper leadership are an absolute mess. No vision, no courage. Covid was badly handled, and we mostly just belatedly copied the U of A. Lots of long-term employees hoard info and get away with appallingly poor behaviour and low productivity, but there are no consequences. People with initiative are actively discouraged from improving student service. Intolerable to see students being so regularly misinformed, stalled, and ignored for anyone who cares. Lots and lots of people have been quitting over the past couple of years, which really says something given how few jobs there are in post sec to move into!

job_title: Working At MacEwan in Edmonton, AB
pros: Sick days, PD days, PD opportunities
cons: No salary raise, that’s all

review_title: Decent job, but the atmosphere gets worse every year.
pros: Colleagues are great and it's really enjoyable to work with students and help solve their problems.
cons: Pretty much everything else. Parking is expensive, staff are blatantly disrespected, and decisions are made without telling anyone about the rationale. There's a reason there's a lot of staff turnover now.

review_title: Good Employer, but costs too much to work there.
pros: Good benefits. Lots of great cultural elements. The facilities are wonderful (gym, pool, etc.) There is diversity in the staff and a great deal of respect amongst colleagues.
cons: There are no flexible work options for administrative staff even though their jobs are completely via computers. Salaries have been frozen for over 6 years so your personal buying power decreases every year. Parking costs $115 - $270/ month , depending on the lot, and is not subsidized

job_title: Front Desk Agent in Edmonton, AB
pros: Great for working around the school schedule and it's on campus. Will give you time off during exams. Can work during school breaks.
cons: They will drop part-time staff pretty quick. Expected to absorb a lot of stuff in a short amount of time with large time gaps in between.

pros:
Coworkers were very welcoming, helpful and friendly.
Decent pay
Good hours
Good location
cons:
It was a casual position so no benefits package
Hours fluctuated from week to week
Tough to get a full time position

pros: It was a decent place to work
cons: None that were especially significant

pros: Fair employer, great benefits (pension, health insurance, vacation, personal leave, etc.)
cons: Communication seems to be a pervasive issue within university

pros: I enjoyed working with some great people. Great compensation and benefits. They have courses to assist with the employees to improve their skills.
cons: The company culture needs improvement. People seem to be always afraid to lose their job and there isn’t any job development

pros: Friendly staff, nice campus, good amenities.
cons:
Not moving toward flexible work arrangements after the pandemic. Making everyone return to the office, even if type of work can be done remotely. 
Salary freeze for non-unionized employees for 6 years and counting. Not offering any additional incentives to staff.
Salaries are much lower than other universities.

review_title: MacEwan University is a great community post secondary institution
pros: Supportive environment to study and thrive
cons: Limited number of programs and courses

pros: nice to live where you work
cons: the housing staff is extremely inconsiderate of residents and ras

pros: great people and place to work
cons: none I think of. nothing

pros: The people and community are great
cons: Parking is expensive in the area

job_title: Working At MacEwan in Edmonton, AB
pros: Worked with school schedule, casual position, at least one shift per week, and on campus.
cons: first one to be let go

pros: Life- work balance is encouraged and you get all the Public holidays off.
cons: If you're not driven, you might become complaisant and stay in one Position

job_title: Customer Service Representative in Edmonton, AB
pros: Love the environment and the clientele
cons: Limited work and hours for casual staff

review_title: excellent pay and benefits but no meaningful/useful work to do
pros: Great benefits, great people, nice and comfortable environment, free coffee and tea provided to some staff
cons:
the amount of tax payer money being wasted on technology and over staffing for positions (i.e. two people hired to do the job of a single person) is mind boggling
And the over use and (frankly) exploitation of sessional faculty (i.e. not permanent staff) was a travesty to witness year after year.

pros:
-benefits
-vacation time
-opportunities for professional development
-ability to move around somewhat to different departments/roles
cons:
-constant fear of layoffs
-management makes decisions without thinking it all through, staff are left to deal with the consequences of poor leadership decisions
-impossible to get rid of bad staff, they will keep truly terrible people for years because they are protected by the staff association
-lack of transparency in decision making
-lack of trust of upper management
-not much salary negotiating power due to the staff association rules

pros: MacEwan University is a collaborative, fun environment in which to work. Good benefits come with the job and the work environment is very good. Lots of nice people. The university responds quickly to change, which is helpful given a fluctuating revenue stream from government. It is a young university with a solid history of providing excellent education and a fantastic student experience. Its downtown location puts it at the hub of Edmonton's downtown business community, which has many benefits. It was a pleasure working there over the last 8 years or so.
cons: Like every university in Alberta facing government budget cuts, job security is not what it used to be. Do more with less is becoming much more common.

pros:
Good compensation.
Faculty excellent.
Staff members supportive.
cons:
No actual union support. Lots of words, no actions. Would rather side with abuses than support the worker. Believe that the administrators run the institution as they wish even when blatant workplace is exhibited.
Human Resources only supports administration and sides with abusive behaviour if senior staff are involved.
Restrictive environment for professional growth.
Environment is heavy with nepotism and favoritism if you tow the line.
No accountability for administrative position hiring--often nepotism. 
No response to workplace harassment and bullying. Policies are following in word only.
Lack of professionalism. 
Ingrained culture of KYA. 
Culture of fear because of reprisal.
Use of taxpayer money to fund secret projects without accountability.
Few quality leaders stay for long--president gone, senior administration leave.

pros: Great team of people to work with. Leaders are very supportive (realistic) about time frames to build courses with SMEs that are also engaged in teaching. State of the art open concept work area is second-to-none, by far the best physical environment I've worked in. MacEwan has put together an impressive catalog of eLearning courses available in Blackboard.
cons: There is a major disconnect between instructional designers and course evaluation; I never received learner feedback on courses that were launched. At times it was frustrating to develop an ADDI model instead of an ADDIE model.

review_title: Wonderful people and great working environment
pros: Extremely enjoyed my time working here along with the experience obtained. There is a lot of friendly people there that are more than willing to help when needed and especially guide you in the right direction. Vacation and pay was great.  HR department is wonderful and pleasure dealing with them (especially Kaisa, such a wonderful and joyful person). Would recommend working here as it is a fun place to be a part of.
cons: Some of the policies and procedures could be little difficult to work with but very open for discussion within employees.

pros:
The people who work here are sincerely devoted to the students and helping each other. I laugh at work all day, every day and get the job done. The vast majority of people who work at MacEwan are working towards the same vision and goals. 

The pay is not up to industry standard but the pension, benefits and professional development opportunities are excellent.
cons: Massive restructuring and budget cuts mean the morale is at an all-time low and the fluctuating leadership is not making it easier.

review_title: This educational institution has grown far too quickly, and can't keep up with itself!
pros: Great vacation benefits - 4 weeks plus Christmas for just over 5 years of service.
cons: There have been huge changes within the University in the past year (financial, student systems), and the roll-out has been far from smooth.

review_title: Hard to change the institutional mentality
pros: Decent wages for the work; flexible with time off depending on dept; good (not the greatest) benefits;
cons: Union makes it impossible to fire incompetent people; you will be stuck working with at least one terrible person (especially throughout the levels of management) and no one will do anything about it; HR and upper management tend to lack integrity; not a lot of opportunity for growth if you don't want to play "the game".

review_title: a place to park your ambitions and put in your time
pros: work life balance, benefit package
cons: anonymous, no recogntion, disconnect between senior management and the business at hand

job_title: Human Resources Representative in Edmonton, AB
pros: Grant MacEwan is centrally located the campus is great to work in.  The benefit package is quite good and the pension is great (LAPP).
cons: There needs to be more attention paid to areas that are undergoing changes to ensure that the employees are not being over worked and have the proper support.

pros: Working at MacEwan provided plenty of opportunity to develop skills, receive training, and to meet new people. I would recommend it to those whole enjoy being active in the community and who enjoy working hard.
cons: It seemed as though some issues with other staff/team members were not dealt with appropriately or taken seriously enough.

pros: MacEwan provides a very secure environment to work in and the different departments and teams tend to have rather passionate people in their departments.
cons: They tend to get familiar in a particular way of doing things and fail to adapt to change.  Currently in a heavily downsizing methodology.

job_title: Course Production Technician in Edmonton, AB
pros: some departments are well organized and have high morale.
cons: I watched my department merge into another which had an unqualified person advanced to a "director" level and without any review of managers, the entire department fell apart, yet everything was fine in the eyes of the director. The incompetence and favoritism displayed forced me to go work elsewhere; just to keep my sanity.

review_title: Great culture and people, but very low pay for non-faculty staff
pros: Great culture and people, very forward thinking organization, full of interesting work.
cons: Very few advancement opportunities and no way to have pay adjusted/re-negotiated once hired even if your credentials have changed. Also, current pay freeze for out of scope staff including non-management means pay will become even less competitive over time.

pros: Good department with great and welcoming staff. Good wage and good hours. Job entailed various duties which were great tools to add to my tool box.
cons: This was a casual part time position so the hours were not always consistent. There were some periods where it wasn't very busy with not as many tasks.

review_title: Enjoyed warm, supportive relationships and opportunities for growth throughout my 5 year tenure.
pros: Vacation - 3-4 weeks to start plus the university closes for a couple of weeks around Christmas.
cons: Subject to provincial government funding changes. Programs which were previously promised government funding had to find new options with the economic downturn.

pros: Students are very appreciative. Lots of opportunity for interaction. Nice group of sessional & full time colleagues.
cons: New Dean has been very negative towards sessionals. Previously town halls asked how admin could help us succeed. Not any longer.  Very disappointing.

pros: MacEwan is a new University and is building its future together. Very collaborative and good work environment. A real sense of community and belonging.
cons: Salaries are low and HR practices need to improve.

pros: Smaller community, smaller classes, great opportunities for students
cons: Growing pains in going to the University level from a community college

pros:
Scheduled staff and delivered the orientation for new recruits.
Trained staff on providing better customer service.
Communicated with vendors and closed the deal.
cons: Controlled inventory throughout the year and working in a fast-paced environment.

pros: Excellent opportunities and culture of excellence
cons: Given Union Environment, lack of performance management tools

pros: The people and community are great! Love the focus on inclusion and the benefits are fantastic.
cons: In my experience, I have yet to find a con

review_title: A very good place to work at
pros: A very good place to work at with friendly environment
cons: Not so competitive salaries. They are almost average

pros: Great pay, flexible hours, pleasant work environment, satisfying work duties
cons: Do not hire full time often

job_title: Social Media Manager in Edmonton, AB
pros: Great benefit package and time off at Christmas
cons: Lots of red tape, poor leadership

pros:
Productive work environment
Lots of Professional Development opportunities
lots of opportunity to move around
cons:
not alot of upwards growth
lots of company politics

job_title: Working At MacEwan in Edmonton, AB
pros: Good benefits, generous vacation entitlement
cons: Long commute, workspace is dark and noisy

job_title: Lead Information Systems in Edmonton, AB
pros: Good package and benefits. Really relaxed and calm Environment
cons: There are Less development opportunities.

pros: Flexible schedule, lots of time off
cons: Pay tens to be than market

review_title: A weird mix of incompetence and arrogance
pros: Great facilities, decent benefits, awesome gym
cons: Management is ruthless, Human Resources is incompetent and arrogant
